definition: to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)
to tremble/to shake out/to reveal/to make it in the world

sentences.english: It was incredible. They reached the shore and were shivering and nervous.
sentences.chinese: 剛一上岸，他倆顯得相當緊張，並且止不住的發抖。

sentences.english: She covered her mouth with her hand, another wave of chills flowing over her as her knees literally knocked together.
sentences.chinese: 她用手捂住嘴，又一陣惡寒讓她全身發抖，膝蓋打顫。

sentences.english: It was one of the most thrilling discords I ever heard.
sentences.chinese: 我從來沒有聽見過這樣叫人發抖的不協和音。

sentences.english: Come sit in your chair, dearie. You're shaking like a leaf.
sentences.chinese: 乖乖，快來坐下，你怕得瑟瑟發抖。

sentences.english: Still, I shook with a mixture of aloneness and terror.
sentences.chinese: 但是我依舊瑟瑟發抖，因爲我孤立無援，充滿恐懼。

sentences.english: But I was shivering with cold, and the pain in my knee was intense.
sentences.chinese: 可是我冷得發抖，膝蓋也痛得厲害。

sentences.english: Her hands were cold and shaky when she began to redden her lips and run a comb through her hair.
sentences.chinese: 當她開始塗口紅和梳理頭髮時，她的雙手冰冷發抖。

sentences.english: The goblin was trembling, unable to meet the red eyes high above his.
sentences.chinese: 那個妖精在發抖，不敢正視高高在上的那雙紅眼睛。

sentences.english: He woke up from a nightmare, trembling with fear.
sentences.chinese: 他從噩夢中驚醒，因爲恐懼而嚇得發抖。

sentences.english: The old man shivered in the cold that came after the sunset.
sentences.chinese: 日落之後，寒氣襲人，老人凍得發抖。

sentences.english: As soon as she got inside the kitchen, Mrs Cousins started to shake.
sentences.chinese: 一進到廚房，卡曾斯太太就開始發抖。

sentences.english: Fearfulness and trembling have come upon me, and horror hath overwhelmed me.
sentences.chinese: 恐懼讓我渾身發抖，驚駭已經淹沒了我。

sentences.english: He shudders if I touch him.
Suddenly, his face changed colour and he trembled from head to toe.
sentences.chinese: 突然間他臉色慘變，渾身發抖。

definition: in a difficult situation/to cut a sorry figure/scoundrel! (derog.)
to tremble/to shiver/to shake/to vibrate/Taiwan pr. [zhan4]
to move emotionally/to stir up (emotions)/to excite
